title: Blindness movie font
content:
Watched the trailer for Blindness and found this fine piece of font. Is it a custom job or does it exist for the masses?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121224355im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/blindness_6222.jpg)

 [‹ Gourmet mag font?](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121224355/http:/www.typophile.com/node/47174 "Go to previous forum topic") [Boyz Magazine Font - Help ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121224355/http:/www.typophile.com/node/47129 "Go to next forum topic")
author: plojel

comments.content: Don’t know about this one but [Blur Light](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121224355/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/fontfont/ff_blur_light/) would be something similar.

Hi Petter,

I’d say custom, because all you need is to apply a filter. A similar font: [FF Blur](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121224355/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/fontfont/ff_blur_ot_light/?sample_text=POWERFUL).  
F

Neville Brodys FF Blur was the father of it, but in this case I think [Distro](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121224355/http:/www.dafont.com/distro.font?nb_ppp=50&af=on&text=POWERFUL) fits too well to be a coincidence. Slightly squooshed of course.
Mmm, filters.. Jan and Florian, thank you for enlightening me swiftly.

In Photoshop if you play around with first bluring slightly your rasterized type, readjust your brightness/contrast, then adding the noise/dust and scratches filter you can get that effect. You will have to play with settings to get the look you want.
